result.execSummary:
The defendant Roechelle M Zabkowicz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment and counseling recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

Maintain full employment and/or combination of schooling.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  No contact with any Boston Store. DNA Sample/Surcharge waived. 
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: STAYED - To be used at Agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.
To be performed as a condition of probation.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on April 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court.   Defendant Roechelle M Zabkowicz did not appear.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek requests the Court reschedule the sentencing hearing as the Defendant is in the hospital. The Court grants the request and reschedules the sentencing hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Sentencing hearing at 03-21-2016 11:00 am

Defendant Roechelle M Zabkowicz in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek advises the Court that the Defendant has paid for but not completed the class and requests additional time for the Defendant to complete the class in March.     Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Hearing at 01-20-2016 09:00 am

Defendant Roechelle M Zabkowicz in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek advises the Court that the Defendant is signed up for the class at UW Milwaukee but has not completed it as of yet and requests an adjournment.  The Court grants the request.  Bail remains as set.  Hearing scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Sentencing hearing at 12-02-2015 09:30 am
